name: Alpine Inn & Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This older-style motel is quiet and away from the railway tracks in Revelstoke but close to the main downtown area. The rooms are circa-1960s but spacious, clean, and comfortable. Check-in was painless, and the free continental breakfast (toast, juice, coffee/tea) was a plus. The staff were very helpful, and we received free passes to the local swimming complex. While in Revelstoke, we saw a movie at the restored heritage cinema downtown, and also took a drive on the Meadows in the Sky parkway (absolutely breathtaking scenery). Would stay here again. Good value for your tourist dollar.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, good location -- older-style motel

reviews.text: The Alpine Inn looked a bit basic when we arrived and some of the furniture was shabby. However,for very little money, we had a reasonably large, clean'apartment' with a kitchen/ dining area, lounge area, large bedroom and bathroom. Revelstoke has a great public swimming pool and free internet in the library. Don't miss the nearby ' Meadows in the sky'.
reviews.title: Good Value and Spacious

likes.liked: — Good size and value for money

description: Alpineinn&suites motel has large rooms with private bathrooms, queen beds, in-room coffee, cable TV with Movie & Sport channels, fridge, air conditioning and individual heat. We also have one or two bedroom suites and kitchen suites available. It's hard to beat the value you receive at the Alpine Inn in Revelstoke.
